New Records: Jude Bellingham scored his first goal at Wembley and became the second Real Madrid player to score for England at Wembley, along with Steve McManaman in September 1999 vs Luxembourg.

Declan Rice became the first Arsenal player to start a match as England captain since Sol Campbell in 2005 against USA, and the first at Wembley since Tony Adams in 2000 against Germany in the final game at the old Wembley.
Ivan Toney is the first player to score a penalty on his first England start since Allan Clarke against Czechoslovakia at the 1970 World Cup.

Ivan Toney is the first Brentford player to score for England, with the Bees the 46th different English league club to provide a scorer for the national side since the creation of the Football League in 1888.
In his 60th England cap, goalkeeper Jordan Pickford made an error leading to an opposition goal for the very first time.
Youri Tielemans became the first Belgian player to score at Wembley for both club (for Leicester City against Chelsea in the 2021 FA Cup final) and country.
Youri Tielemans was the first player to score two first half goals against England since Tranquillo Barnetta in June 2011 for Switzerland.
Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham's 94th-minute equaliser salvaged a draw for England.
Jordan Pickford's poor clearance led to Youri Tielemans putting Belgium ahead after 11 minutes.
Ivan Toney equalised from the penalty spot six minutes later after being brought down by Jan Vertonghen.
Lewis Dunk's mistake allowed Romelu Lukaku to provide the perfect cross for Tielemans to head in Belgium's second goal.
Jarrod Bowen had a close-range header ruled out for offside.
Matz Sels saved well from Bowen before Bellingham's last-minute equaliser.
Pre-Game Insights: England's final game before Euro 2024 squad is announced.
Gareth Southgate's side play further friendlies against Bosnia-Herzegovina & Iceland before the tournament opener on 16 June.
England lost 1-0 to Brazil on Saturday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Ivan Toney expressed his joy at scoring and praised his teammates, especially Kobbie Mainoo.
Jan Vertonghen commented on the tough match and the missed opportunity to win.
Jarrod Bowen highlighted the resilience of the England squad and the importance of contributions from all players.
Jude Bellingham reflected on the importance of the draw and praised Kobbie Mainoo's performance.
Gareth Southgate felt the performance deserved the draw and was pleased with the team's effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England remain unbeaten against Belgium on English soil, winning six and drawing two.
This was the second time England came from 2-1 down at half-time to draw 2-2 against Belgium, the first being in 1964.
